intro: Microstylis moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan microstylis, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
